column4: hi. i need some help while installing ipw2100 on my Acer Laptop. I compiled and installed  ieee80210 and ipw2100 modules but i get this error msg while loading the module : http://paste.debian.net/15806
can anybody help me ? :)
can anybody help me ? :)

hi. i need some help while installing ipw2100 on my Acer Laptop. I compiled and installed  ieee80210 and ipw2100 modules but i get this error msg while loading the module : http://paste.debian.net/15806
did you compile that module yourself?
i compiled it myselvm based on this tutorial http://frealek.dotnode.com/blog/view/177
ok, hold on
that tutorial includes compiling your own kernel. Did you do that?
no i didnt. reason : my kernel is up2date as i installed ubuntu 3 days ago and made apt-get upgrade ...
ok, well that's your reason then. The errors you get are because the cryptography modules needed for this driver to work aren't available in your kernel
You might want to consider reading the tutorials on the wiki for recompiling the kernel
i dont get that.. my kernel did already work with the ipw2100 drivers ubuntu came with.  i just wanted to re-install current versions of ipw2100 and ieee80210...
yes, but the headers for the 802.11x part weren't available when you compiled it, so that's why it fails
you should stick with the ubuntu version of the drivers
too late but a good hint :)
what do i do now ? puttin ubuntu dic back to drive and re-install ubuntu ? :'(
no, that shouldn't be necessary. Try apt-get --reinstall install <name of your driver>
apt didnt find the package
so, what exactly did you do that made the previous driver unavailable?
ok, just find out what files it removed (and replaced, so that should be easy) and search for one of them at packages.ubuntu.com - then you can do the apt-get --reinstall part
you're welcome
